key_channel_insights.line_content: OTA consistently offers higher prices across nearly all observations compared to direct bookings, dominating at 98.7%.
MSE shows high pricing parity with LATAM's website, maintaining same pricing for 61.6% of offers.
GDS offers predominantly higher prices with 79.92% of itineraries priced above those found on LATAM's website.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Across all dimensions, the OTA channel shows higher prices compared to direct bookings, with 98.7% of offers priced higher last week.
Offers priced lower on OTA were exceedingly rare, comprising just 0.22% of all observations.
Price comparisons between OTA and direct site remained largely stable across weeks and months, reflecting minimal fluctuation in pricing strategies.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: For 0.88% of observed itineraries, direct website offers were not found on the OTA, with a slight rise of 0.28% compared to previous weeks.
Only 0.2% of itineraries had identical pricing across OTA and direct channels, with no material changes over the past weeks or months.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: 98.99% of short-haul itineraries were priced higher on OTA, with a minimal variation of +0.31% in price differences compared to the previous week.
While still predominantly higher, long-haul itineraries show slightly reduced OTA premiums at 94.93%, with a consistent 0.10% price difference over time.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For 99.7% of Brazil-origin itineraries, OTA prices were higher, a significant contrast to a 62% higher rate in non-Brazil origins.
In non-Brazil origins, a small but notable 0.31% of routes had lower prices on OTA, unchanged from prior data.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Most far-out itineraries, 99.37%, maintained higher pricing on OTA, with price differences decreasing slightly by 0.18% month-on-month.
Close-in bookings predominantly exhibited higher prices on OTAs at 98.4%, with stable price differences reflecting a consistent pricing strategy.

mse_highlights.line_content: A significant 61.6% of offers on MSE match LATAM's website prices, showing high price consistency for the latest week.
Offers not found on MSE decreased 2.1% over the past month, suggesting improved listing efficiency.
MSE listed lower prices than the website 32.4% of the time, a slight increase from the previous month.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Price parity remains steady across dimensions, with same pricing accounting for over 61.6% in the latest week.
MSE lower offers increased by 2.4% since last month, potentially enhancing competitive advantages.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Short haul flights show steady trends with MSE lower pricing at 32.7%, although this is a slight decrease from last week's data.
A 5.1% increase in lower pricing on MSE for long haul services suggests increased competitive pricing opportunities.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: MSE pricing for Brazil routes consistently shows lower prices, with a 37.6% occurrence of cheaper tickets.
Offers from non-Brazil origins show a significant occurrence of the same pricing (62.2%), but also a 2.5% increase in MSE higher listings.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: With close-in bookings, 64.6% of MSE offers match website prices, indicating minimal short-term variability.
Far-out bookings show substantial savings, with 37.4% of MSE prices lower than website offers, shifting +4.5% from prior month.

gds_highlights.line_content: A significant 79.92% of all itineraries in the GDS channel were priced higher than on LATAM's website last week, showing a stable slightly upward trend from prior weeks, with frequencies of 78.73% and 78.86%.
Only 1.25% of cases had lower prices on the GDS last week. This figure reflects a slight decline from the previous month, marking a consistent pattern of lower frequency for GDS lower pricing.

gds_highlights.line_title: High Frequency of Website Prices Not Found
gds_highlights.line_content: The non-availability of website offers on the GDS accounted for 18.24% of cases, indicating a slight decrease from previous weeks.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: The GDS channel consistently displays higher prices, hovering around 80% across all records, showing minimal fluctuations in its dominance.
Cases of the GDS being lower than the website were rare across all time frames, never exceeding 1.54% in any dimension.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Short haul itineraries continue to see prices higher in the GDS channel 79.21% of the time, a marginal increase.
Long haul presents slightly higher occurrences of identical pricing, but still predominantly shows higher GDS pricing at 89.43% last week.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Within Brazil-origin itineraries, the dominance of higher GDS pricing is pronounced at 99.7% last week, indicating market-specific tendencies.
Non-Brazil itineraries exhibit a relatively lower occurrence of higher GDS pricing at 68.79%, showing more variance compared to Brazil.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in booking window records a consistently high GDS higher pricing at 80.18%, with minor decrease over the observed periods.
Far-out bookings also show a strong frequency of higher GDS pricing at 79.42%, indicating minimal change and reinforcing established tendencies.
